result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron A. Rennhack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:33 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Aaron A. Rennhack in court, in-custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3

On Counts #1 & #4, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (Count #4); to commence 1/2/2015 by 5:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least 1x/month for the 1st 6 months of supervision)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs 
--No possesion or consumption of marijuana or THC
--No contact with Paris Selvie
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--Contact with brother Tim and Father David Rennhack by discretion of the Agent
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each count)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $25 drug testing fee (Count #4)

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 10:57 am
State's (with cover letter)
Scheduling order
Jury trial on June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
WCCA print screen with notation that Attorney Rhiel is appointed in this case //with SPD order appointing attached
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 11:59 am 
Defendant Aaron A. Rennhack in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that he is counsel of record
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that It has reviewed letter sumitted by Def. Counsel

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Rennhack waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that an agreement has not been reached; requests matter be set on trial calendar
Counsel agree 1 day will be needed for trial
Court continues bond

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC  6/10/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 6/16/14 at 8:30 am  - Send notices
from Def. Counsel re: missed court date
Status conference on May 2, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Scheduling notice

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 2:21pm. 
Defendant Aaron A. Rennhack in court, in custody.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Rennhack indicates that he believes Attorney John Rhiel represents him in this case. 
The Court notes that at the 3/27/14 hearing Attorney Rhiel clarified that he does not represent Mr. Rennhack in this case. 
The Court reviews right to counsel and instructs Mr. Rennhack to arrange through jail staff to meet with the PD.  
Attorney Svehlek, who is present in the courtroom gallery, indicates that she will ask PD staff to provide the eligibility paperwork to Mr. Rennhack in the jail, so that he can complete that paperwork.
recess 2:30pm. 


NEXT:  schedule Status Conference--JA please note in comments that purpose of Status Conference is to learn if Mr. Rennhack has counsel and to schedule the Preliminary Hearing on 5/2/14 at 11:15am.     (Mr. Rennhack is in JCJ until 9/26/14 serving a conditional jail term)
Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 9, 2014 at 09:40 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 13CF178, 13CF334, 13CF500 & 14CF72 called together at 2:44 pm 
Defendant Aaron A. Rennhack in court with Attorney John V. Rhiel. ADA Theresa Ann Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that he does not represent Mr. Rennhack on 14CF72, but willing to appear as friend of the Court
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Rennhack indicates that he would like to proceed with initial app. today

14CF72:
Service of the Complaint Admitted; Reading waived
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by parties

Court requires a $2000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Paris J. Selvie  
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 

Atty Rhiel informs the Court that only case 13CF500 has restitution to be decided.
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that they have reached a stipulation, that victim had out of pocket expense of $1054.99, Mr. Rennhack will have ability to pay this amount; Victim was paid $7509 for the totaled value of the vehicle; medical expenses are being settled by separate civil suit, by agreement of State-will not be addressed by this court

Aaron Rennhack--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Rhiel
--cross exam by ADA Beck
--redirect exam by Atty Rhiel
Court presents basis, finds that Mr. Rennhack is unable to pay full amount of restitution. Court orders Defendant to pay $100/month during the 1st year ($1200) of probation and then $150/month in years 2 and 3 ($1800 year) of probation and orders Mr. Rennhack to pay $1054.99 restitution payable to Ryan Charles Davis for out of pocket expenses along with $3745 payable to Insurance Company for totaled vehicle.
Court enters civil judgment against Mr. Rennhack in favor of Insurance Company for remaining amount of $3764 for the totaled vehicle.
Recess: 3:07 pm 

NEXT: 14CF72: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 4/9/14 at 9:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 4/25/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
